comments:
The performance graph generator throws a FileNotFoundException when run on 
Linux. Problem is, the generator tries to copy over a couple files: 
Tooltip.css and Tooltip.js. This "copy" only works on Windows because Windows 
is case insensitive. However, on Linux, it won't able to find these files 
because Linux is case sensitive.

java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/build-
home/org.eclipse.releng.basebuilder/plugins/org.eclipse.test.performance.ui/scr
ipts/Tooltip.css (No such file or directory)
     [java] 	at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
     [java] 	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:106)
     [java] 	at org.eclipse.test.performance.ui.Utils.copyFile
(Utils.java:286)
     [java] 	at org.eclipse.test.performance.ui.Main.run(Main.java:63)
     [java] 	at org.eclipse.test.performance.ui.Main.main(Main.java:38)
     [java] java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/build-
home/org.eclipse.releng.basebuilder/plugins/org.eclipse.test.performance.ui/scr
ipts/Tooltip.js (No such file or directory)
     [java] 	at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
     [java] 	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:106)
     [java] 	at org.eclipse.test.performance.ui.Utils.copyFile
(Utils.java:286)
     [java] 	at org.eclipse.test.performance.ui.Main.run(Main.java:64)
     [java] 	at org.eclipse.test.performance.ui.Main.main(Main.java:38)

Thanks for reporting this, I have released a fix released to HEAD.  Please 
reopen the problem persists.
